story: Hm.  I can't see anything.  You'd think there would be a rabbit in the rabbithole, right?
We do have a special weapon.  We can see hidden objects with the tag -a
The flag -a stands for All
Try typing the command ls -a
We found a trapdoor
But there's also a key..
Do we need the key?  It looks open..
Ok!  It looks like we didn't need the key after all!
Look around again
Huh, there's a locked door
We may need to use the key!
Go back to the previous room using 'cd ..'
Maybe we should take a closer look at the key
Read the contents of the key file
Use the command 'less .key'
Some of these commands look familiar
We learnt before that chmod would change the permission on the key
But I don't think this key is in the right directory
Try moving the key to the directory above
OK!  Now we could run the commands in the .key file individually
But wouldn't it be good if we could run the commands in the file directly?
Lets check out the permissions of the file
Do you remember how to find out more about a file?
7.hint: Type the command "ls -la" in the .trapdoor directory

story: If we make this file executable, we can run the commands in the file
We can see this file is readable only
Lets change it so it's also executable
8.hint: Type the command "chmod +x .key" in the .trapdoor directory

story: Excellent!  Now let's run the script
Use .key to run the executible file
9.hint: Type the command ".key" in the .trapdoor directory
